formattedAddress: 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: No-frills, cash-only burger counter hidden inside an upscale hotel.

originalText.text: It was quite a challenge to locate the place. Despite having heard and read about it as one of the best burger joints in Manhattan, it wasn't easy to find. Upon reaching the restaurant, we found it to be extremely crowded. There was a queue of around 30 to 40 people and it was difficult to navigate through the restaurant due to the congestion. However, the food was worth the wait. The burgers were of decent size and the fries were also a good portion. The taste and quality of the food were amazing. I would highly recommend this place.

originalText.text: My first experience at this hidden burger joint!!!! The burgers were seasoned to perfection and fries were fresh. It‚Äôs kind of pricey; however, what do you expect living in NYC when everything is pricey!!! The staff was nice and the lines moved quickly !!! I ordered a single cheeseburger and fries. I will definitely return to the burger joint.

I will definitely return to the burger joint.

originalText.text: Not sure if you can find here the best burger in Manhattan, but what it is a fact is that it is the best place to have it. The burgers of course are really good but the place and the atmosphere are really amazing. The best burger in Manhattan is hidden behind a red curtain. This is what I was told. And fully agree. Will be back for sure

originalText.text:
Double cheese burger with fries and coke was about 39 bucks. They explained when charging that they only accept cash tips.

They told me to sit anywhere, I chose a booth and it was dirty as all the other tables. They called my name and I had to pick the order up from the counter, so I‚Äôm not really sure why they even mentioned a tip since they don‚Äôt clean up and they don‚Äôt serve you.

The ingredients taste like great quality! But the beef patty was unseasoned and extremely bland. Not worth the price in my opinion.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, staff is nice and do smile but everything else was below average.

Finally, while eating I noticed how they actually brought the food to the table for 3 different consumers. Kinda weird they brought the food and they asked me to pick it up from the counter. Also kinda suspicious that the ones they served were white people and I am brown.

Anyway, that‚Äôs my input. Q
